narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: i learned a lot about the psychology of common diseases we see in the public, it definitely made me more understanding and open to everyone's conditions

I developed much more background in clinical psychology, etiology, prevalence, and diagnoses criteria. I also learned about effective and ineffective treatments for disorders, as well as the effects of stigma.

I learned about all sorts of different mental disorders, including their biological, psychological, and sociocultural factors. We also learned about stigma and issues with current diagnostic techniques.
I learned about abnormal or clinical psychology and about a lot of disorders.
Knowledge of clinical psychology as well as the statistics and symptoms of mental disorders

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: very informative course, prof. joormann and ashleigh
weaknesses: the course could benefit from more than just rehashing our discussion questions every class

This class was wonderful. One suggestion is that the lecture videos be adjusted so that we have to watch 13 videos prior to the Tuesday class (when we have ~5 days to complete) instead of the Thursday class (~a day and a half to complete).

The strengths of the course are in part Prof. Joormann and Ashleigh. They were both really nice and facilitated good discussions. The biggest weakness was the sheer amount of time all the homework took. I personally take pretty thorough notes on the textbook readings, so those would sometimes take me basically a full to do, then hours of videos on top of it. I get summer classes have to be fast paced; it was just very tedious.

The section was like seminar class and resulted in a lot of personal experience being shared. I think it could have been more structured with actual assignments so students weren't expected to share personal thoughts about the material.

Strengths: all of the information was very clear and thorough 
Weaknesses: there were not that many assignments in class, so the final grade rests on the midterm and final

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes
yes, the class was thorough and very interesting

I would recommend it only if you know youre passionate about psychology. The course material isnt too challenging, and you can probably get an A if you just work hard throughout, but it can feel slow.
Yes, I gained a lot of insight into psychology and about people who experience disorders.
Absolutely! This course gives an all-around understanding of clinical psychology that is very comprehensive.
Yes, if you are interested in learning factual information about clinical disorders, then take this course!
